identified-content.classifier: Roosevelt, Franklin Delano, Home and Library (Hyde Park, NY)

abstract.p: Scenic Hudson will purchase two parcels opposite Franklin Delano Roosevelt Home and Library in Hyde Park, NY, thus removing them from development speculation (S)

block.p: Scenic Hudson, an environmental group, is buying two parcels opposite the Franklin Delano Roosevelt Home and Library in Hyde Park for $3.1 million, ending a decade of conflict over development in the area. One of the properties, the Hyde Park Drive-In, was touched off controversy in the 1990's when a Wal-Mart was proposed. Scenic Hudson's purchase removes the land from development speculation. The organization has not chosen a use for the site, but ideas include a Depression and World War II-era museum, a transportation hub for the town and its historic sites, a village green and a period restoration of the theater.

The organization has not chosen a use for the site, but ideas include a Depression and World War II-era museum, a transportation hub for the town and its historic sites, a village green and a period restoration of the theater.
